commination noun [C or U]
(JUDGMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal the act of threatening to punish someone, or an occasion when someone does this: Other people she knew would have nothing but commination for him. He confined his feelings to muttered accusations and private comminations.
More examplesFewer examplesWhat is evident is the loss of emotional control, and the replacement of analysis with commination.

commination noun [C or U]
(IN CHURCH)
religion
  specialized prayers about God's judgements that are said in some Christian churches on Ash Wednesday (= the first day of Lent, a period when, for religious reasons, some Christians stop doing particular things that they enjoy): "The Book of Common Prayer" mentioned a great variety of Christian gatherings, including Communion, baptism, comminations, burials, and so on. Allowance was made for the role of the choir in morning and evening prayer, at burials, and at the commination.
